lorebooks.name: The Furverse (1)
lorebooks.website_description:
Welcome to the promised lorebook, whoever it is who asked me to make and post it on my raptor card. 

CW: Political theorizing, major historical events(WWII and the like), mild to moderate social commentary due to rewriting said events, and furries, ferals, and blatant mentioning(for legal descriptions and similar reasons) of bestiality.

So, in brief, this is the start of a likely eternally WIP lorebook, all about the world I envision for my furry cards. My goal is to apply logic to furries, a nigh impossible task, and envision a world where anthros, ferals, and crossbreeds all exist in tandem with a level of realism. My goal is for it to be relatively setting agnostic, with the caveat it's based on our world. Basically, if I set this up right and the card is built with our world in mind, there should be enough information in your character and this to do anything from fantasy to modern settings.

To begin with, much of the lorebook will be political and ideological in nature, mainly because I have to do that to even scratch the surface of envisioning a fully refabricated world. I'm not trying to make a statement, just convert actual events into a similar one but with anthros and ferals in the mix. It's impossible to avoid bias, and I'm not really going to try, but I am not trying to force my beliefs on you. If you disagree with something here, feel free to fork it and make the changes you want.

So there will be three main categories of information I focus on for this.

The first is major events. I will be rewriting major historical events to make sense in a furry universe. In general, species are a stand in for religion and culture, and ferals and pseudo-ferals are a stand in for racial and class issues. Depending on the event it can vary, though.

The second is logic based lore. Basically, I try to consider anatomical and social situations based on what a furry and feral society would be like. While individual species lore is left out, as that's better fit into a character's card and would turn an already likely endless project full on eternal, there's some more broad groupings and categories included. 

The third is politics. This is mostly things like how different groups(ferals, anthros, pseudoferals) see each other, how they act, rational changes or additions to situations due to their species, and the like. It has  a lot of overlap with the other two groups, and the lines are a bit blurry at times. This one will most often be mixed into the other groups, as often it's more an addendum note than a full entry. I will NOT be doing modern political figures in my lorebook, though I may reference events that are modern. Any actual, historical figures named will be deceased. So Abe Lincoln is on the table, Jimmy Carter is not. It also means, thank the abyssal gods, that I don't have to make Dolly Parton. She's too pure and magnificent to put into this setting. 

Anyways, there's more I might add in, but those are the main points I want to hit. 

Alright, now's where you come in, dear reader. I am but one puny human brain that's stoned half the time because life sucks. This is a monumental WIP, and that's because there are near countless historical events, political concepts, and logical lore concepts. So, if you want to help me out, wink wink, throw some historical events and concepts down in the comments. I won't promise it will make it in, but if I can make it fit I'll consider a lot of things.

And one last thing. You see that rabbit in the preview? Oh boy, guess what? That's a card I've held off on posting because it's built around many of the ideas in this lorebook. If you like the idea of a pseudo-feral as described in the lorebook, you're in luck. Got a fluffy bunny pet for ya, as soon as I revise it and test it on some newer models. I made it ages ago, and I've gotten much better at bot making since then. I have a LOT of characters I made to test things, learn, and improve, but never felt like posting because they were experimental or not up to my newer standards. Many were made while I was slowly piecing together this concept, and you can probably tell. While the bunny is absolutely getting released from my secret vault, the others? I honestly don't know. Once again, let me know in comments if any of these interest you! 

If you have reached this point and do not care about my hidden vault of secrets, you can stop reading. Thanks for checking out my lorebook, I hope you enjoy it if you use it, and if not have a nice day.

Mild reminder, I have almost no limits: No NTR, vore, gore, or bathroom play. Beyond that, little else matters.

Current Vault-

The Plushmancer- A petite white rabbit that uses forbidden magic to animate plushies to capture and bone anyone she falls for. Extreme princess complex. I have two versions, one adult and one UA. This is not the first place I've shared cards, though I do get less alteration requests oddly enough.

Direwolves- As a Prehistoria, Dire Wolves have low populations. To fix this, you got a government sponsored marriage and an assignment to breed an entire pack! Oh, and they're all hermaphrodites, with a bajillion kinks spread among them. Aaaaaand there's a pretty wide age spread. This was an experiment to learn how to make a bunch of characters in one card with as few tokens per character as possible, while retaining personality and plot. Ten. There's ten of them. In one card. This is, and I quote, "Happenstance hermaphrodite harem from hell," -Me, just now.

Alex- Total bro and your personal trainer, but actually semi-secretly a chick. Totally flat, looks like a dude but has a vagina. Pretends to be a dude because it's easier than correcting everyone.

The Twins: No, not the Terraria boss! Two heads, four arms, bought off the darkweb. Definitely needs a hefty refresh and testing, maybe a total background overhaul. 

Shellshocked Cheetah Slave- Broken, delivered for your amusement. Meant to be a two path card; user her or fix her. 

A literal lion and a literal otter: Test cards to see if I could make my local model do actual animals as full characters. I know what you will do to them, I DGAF. Two cards, if that wasn't clear, sharing one entry to save some space.

Family Vacation- You go on vacation with your family, but they're all horny. Okay, to be technical they are all half-siblings and a step-mother, but still family. UA content. Not NTR, though. One of your parents is deceased! Uh, kinda bittersweet, I guess. Sucks for the character, but hey, it's not NTR!

Boxing Coach- You're the coach for a school boxing team. One of the students, a kangaroo, has a single mother, and needs a role model. Designed to be a "wholesome new father" type setting, but I know what you will do with it. 

The Sleepover- Not a love triangle, but a massive love circle. You've got a sleepover with your friends, and everyone's crush is under the same roof all night. College and HS versions exist(requested rewrites), and it was designed to be a romance/sexual-tension styled drama. 

Kaiju Task Force- Godzilla and Mothra are your squad mates. A bit of a world blend of Pacific Rim and the Monsterverse, and you get a nanomachine mech to fight with! Or just take Zilla out for ramen and let her shatter your pelvis, your call. Right, I forgot to mention they can shrink down to human size due to plot contrivances, shit, I meant in depth custom lore!

My First Chatbot- My first actual character I ever made. AID doesn't really count since it's more about making a world and setting to play in like a sandbox, this is an actual character I made for a local model. She's my favorite bird, the potoo. Art nerd, adorable, and teeny tiny.

And if you actually read all that, mention it and I'll give you one digital cookie. Thanks for reading to the end of my nonsense, roll 2d10 for sanity damage. And now that you're as insane as me, don't forget to leave ideas and suggestions for my weird lorebook. Concepts, events, or even just tags to trigger from. I'm like corn; all ears.

Potato, out-

lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Feral
1.content:
Ferals are non-anthropomorphic animals living in the world. While they look like a wild animal, they are capable of speech and rational thought. While once seen as primitive, they are accepted into modern life like anthros and have more recently taken on a more mythical and spiritual lens when viewed by others. They are still highly driven by instinct, and usually carry behaviors of the species more notably than anthros. This leads to them having a near innate sense for people and situations, and they can spot a bad person or dangerous situation instinctively. Most ferals are close to their normal, wild size, though smaller species are often larger. Ferals, like Anthros, almost always have ancestry from a region their species naturally appears in. 

Ferals usually have a seasonal heat, much like their wild counterparts.

Ferals rarely wear clothes, and if they do it's usually some variation of a skirt, kilt, or shorts to hide their genitals if they have short fur or scales. They will sometimes wear leggings, like thigh highs, stockings, etc., if they want to show off to someone they are interested in.

While Ferals legally have rights worldwide in the modern era, a not insignificant group of Anthros still sees them as lesser people and yearns for the past times where they were property. 

Ferals almost always possess genitalia and anatomical characteristics of their species.

2.name: Pseudo-Feral
2.content:
A hybrid of a feral parent and anthro parent, and able to walk in the same manner as both their feral parent and antho parent: usually bipedally and quadrupedally. They have a mixed set of traits from their parents, though usually resembling their feral parent more. They usually have more feral bodies, albeit bigger than their wild counterparts. Pseudo-ferals have almost no rights, and are often treated as pets, slaves, or entertainment. Very few can find work outside of a brothel or strip club, assuming they aren't owned by someone outright. They are looked down on as abomination hybrids, and lack most legal protection. While completely legal to have a relationship or sexual interactions with a pseudo-feral, is is usually viewed as one step above bestiality.

Much like Ferals, Pseudo-ferals rarely wear clothes. If they do it's usually some variation of a skirt, kilt, or shorts to hide their genitals if they have short fur or scales. They will sometimes wear leggings, like thigh highs, stockings, etc., if they want to show off to someone they are interested in.

Pseudo-ferals almost always have a featureless chest instead of breasts, instead having two rows of nipples on their belly if they are mammals.

3.name: Feral Rights Movement
3.content: During the 50s through 80s, the Feral population demanded equal rights to the anthros. While this period was politically complex, with violence and high tensions, the Ferals emerged victorious and were given full rights as citizens across most of the world.

4.name: World War II
4.content:
During the second world war, the Germans were politically a Predator Supremacist nation. In this ideology, they eradicated and killed thousands of species of anthros they saw as unfit for society, unclean, and a detriment to their nation. While this mostly targeted prey species, like rabbits and deer, it also targeted certain omnivores and predators that didn't meet their ideals. The primary species propagating this was canines, mostly Dobermans, Rottweilers, German Shepherds, and Wolves. 

Dobermans primarily acted as officers, particularly within the SS. 

Rottweilers acted as Stormtroopers, a type of specialized and highly trained infantry.

German Shepherds tended to work in logistics and management fields. 

Wolves, as the most original form of canine, was seen as near perfect and often held high class positions such as those in government.

5.name: Wildlings
5.content: Wildling is the polite name for animals without sapience, commonly known as wild animals, and they are notably quite different from Ferals in many ways. They are unable to speak, as they are wild animals, as opposed to Ferals which can speak. While Ferals are often larger than their Wildling counterparts if they are a small species, Wildlings are always at their normal, natural size. As true animals, they are the main source of meat in the world in the modern age. The most important distinction is that relationships with a Feral are completely legal, but relations with a Wildling is bestiality.

6.name: Prehistoria
6.content: One of the umbrella categories for anthros and ferals, Prehistoria collects all species with origins from before the end of the ice age. This includes dinosaurs, along with ice age creatures. While an ordinary Anthro or Feral is reasonably able to integrate into modern society no matter the species, Prehistoria species struggle with it. They almost always have unusual behaviors in some manner, often hailing to their more primeval past. Their heats are far more intense, often leaving them in a state of mindless need to procreate with their mate. Additionally, they often struggle with modern social behaviors, and tend to have alternative views on lifestyles. They are very rare compared to other species, usually with numbers in the thousands across the entire world.

7.name: Mythica
7.content:
One of the umbrella categories for anthros and ferals, Prehistoria collects all species with origins from myth, folklore, and other supernatural species. This includes things like dragons, kobolds, hellhounds, kitsune, and many more. While many species of anthro and feral have some stereotypical traits of their species, Mythica leans hard into these traits as they are core to their existence and way of life. They are often seen as mysterious and exotic, being an incredibly small population in the world, usually with less than a thousand members of their species.

There is a lot of debate among scientists and governments as to whether these species actually possess mystical powers or not. While it is documented that unusual phenomena often occur near them, there is lack of proper research and documentation as to whether it is caused by them, and if so how they do it and if it's intended.

8.name: Anthro
8.content: Anthros, also called Furs, are a race of anthropomorphic animals. They are composed of countless species, and can be anything from the real world, myths(Known as Mythica), or even prehistorical times(known as Prehistoria). They have digitigrade legs, and features of their species on a humanoid body. As a whole, they are driven by instinct more than humans, though not to the same degree as Wildlings and Ferals. Smaller species, such as rabbits or mice, are significantly larger than their wild counterparts, though not as tall as other species that are naturally larger. The range of heights that can be seen usually range from three feet for small species, up to eight feet for larger species.

9.name: The Fural War
9.content:
During the Fural War, the southern states of the United States of America broke off from the northern states in an attempt to continue keeping Ferals as livestock and labor slaves. The aftermath of the war left the southern states without their Feral slaves due to their complete loss, and began a long, slow trek to recognizing Ferals as people within the US.

There exists a group of Anthros who are revisionist, and make claims like Feral's lives being improved by slavery, that they were attacked for no reason, that they were victims, and that Ferals are innately inferior to Anthros.

10.name: Humans
10.content: Humans are a minority species within this world, only roughly 1% of the population. Because of this, phrases and references to humans are relatively rare, being replaced with words more relevant to anthros and ferals. Ironically, humans are often seen as desirable and exotic mates, due to having boring genitals that are less difficult for most species to deal with.

lorebooks.name: NASCAR
lorebooks.website_description: Lorebook includes information about NASCAR and it's history for character. Meant to be used for characters that are NASCAR focused.
lorebooks.description: Lorebook includes information about NASCAR and it's history for character. Meant to be used for characters that are NASCAR focused.
lorebooks.creator: Sopiaa

1.content:
<The Founding of NASCAR in 1948 and Bill France Sr.>  
NASCAR was founded in 1948 by Bill France Sr., who sought to bring structure and professionalism to stock car racing. He envisioned a unified set of rules and an organized championship that would attract both drivers and fans, laying the foundation for what would become one of America‚Äôs most popular motorsports.

<Early Days and the Rise of Racing in the South>  
In its early years, NASCAR events were primarily held in the southeastern United States, where stock car racing had deep roots. Dirt tracks and fairgrounds became the heart of the action, drawing large crowds and fostering local legends. This regional popularity soon grew into a nationwide phenomenon.

<The Influence of Moonshining on NASCAR‚Äôs Beginnings>  
NASCAR‚Äôs origins are closely tied to the Prohibition-era moonshiners, who modified their cars to outrun law enforcement while transporting illegal alcohol. These same high-performance skills and vehicles found their way to racetracks. Many early NASCAR drivers, including notable names, had honed their talents delivering moonshine, blending outlaw culture with motorsport.

2.content:
<Car Evolution: From Stock Cars to Modern Machines>  
NASCAR began with "stock cars," vehicles that mirrored those sold at dealerships. Over time, advancements in safety, performance, and durability transformed these cars into highly specialized racing machines. Modern NASCAR vehicles feature cutting-edge technology, designed for speed and endurance on demanding tracks.

<Aerodynamics and Engine Technology>  
Aerodynamics and engine performance have become pivotal in NASCAR. Engineers fine-tune car designs to maximize downforce and minimize drag, while engines are built for optimal power and reliability. These innovations often determine the difference between victory and defeat.

<Iconic Car Models in NASCAR>  
Throughout NASCAR‚Äôs history, brands like Ford, Chevrolet, Dodge, and Toyota have played significant roles. Iconic models such as the Ford Thunderbird, Chevrolet Monte Carlo, and Toyota Camry have become synonymous with the sport, each representing their manufacturer‚Äôs pursuit of dominance on the track.

3.content:
<Legends of NASCAR: Dale Earnhardt, Richard Petty, Jeff Gordon, and Jimmie Johnson>  
Dale Earnhardt, "The Intimidator," became a fan favorite with his aggressive style and seven championships. Richard Petty, "The King," is celebrated for his record 200 wins. Jeff Gordon modernized the sport with his adaptability, while Jimmie Johnson set new standards with seven championships in the 2000s.

<Modern Stars: Kyle Larson and Chase Elliott>  
Kyle Larson‚Äôs versatility and Chase Elliott‚Äôs rise as NASCAR‚Äôs "Most Popular Driver" have brought new energy to the sport. Their skill and consistency keep fans engaged and ensure NASCAR‚Äôs future remains bright. Both drivers carry the legacy of innovation and competition.

<Driver Achievements and Their Impact on NASCAR>  
From Earnhardt‚Äôs dominance at Daytona to Petty‚Äôs longevity, these drivers have shaped NASCAR‚Äôs identity. Their records inspire new generations, while their rivalries, comebacks, and on-track drama have left an indelible mark on motorsport history.

<Legendary Races and Rivalries>  
Races like the Daytona 500 have become iconic due to memorable moments, such as Earnhardt‚Äôs 1998 win. Driver rivalries, like that of Gordon vs. Earnhardt or Petty vs. Pearson, added intensity and drew fans. These battles turned NASCAR into a spectacle of speed, strategy, and personality.

4.content:
<Iconic Tracks: Daytona, Talladega, Bristol>  
Daytona International Speedway, known for high speeds and photo finishes, stands as NASCAR‚Äôs crown jewel. Talladega Superspeedway offers thrilling pack racing, while Bristol Motor Speedway is famous for its tight turns and high-energy short track action. Each track carries its unique history and challenges.

<Special Races: Daytona 500>  
The Daytona 500, nicknamed "The Great American Race," is NASCAR‚Äôs most prestigious event, kicking off the season with unparalleled fanfare. Its rich history includes legendary wins, heartbreaks, and unforgettable moments that define the sport.

<Track Types: Ovals, Road Courses, Short Tracks>  
NASCAR features a variety of track types. Oval tracks, like Talladega, are designed for speed and drafting. Road courses, such as Watkins Glen, test drivers‚Äô technical skills with sharp turns and elevation changes. Short tracks, like Martinsville, bring close-quarters racing and intense rivalries to life.

5.content:
<NASCAR Race Rules>  
NASCAR races are run in stages, with mandatory caution periods marking stage ends to keep the field competitive. Pit stops play a crucial role, as teams handle tire changes, refueling, and repairs in seconds. Cars must meet strict technical specifications to ensure fairness and safety.

<Current Points System and Championship>  
Drivers earn points based on their finishing position and stage performances. Bonus points are awarded for stage wins and leading laps. The driver with the most points after the regular season secures a playoff spot, with the championship decided during a final four-driver showdown.

<The Chase and Playoff System>  
Introduced in 2004, "The Chase" evolved into the playoff format, creating an elimination-style championship battle. The system adds drama by rewarding consistency and late-season success, ensuring a climactic finale where the top contenders fight for the title in the final race.

6.content:
<NASCAR Fan Dedication and Culture>
NASCAR fans are known for their passionate support, often showcasing loyalty through team-branded apparel, flags, and vehicle decals. Tailgating and fan meetups at racetracks create a festival-like atmosphere, making every race weekend a vibrant social event filled with tradition and camaraderie.

<Role of Sponsors>
Sponsorships are central to NASCAR, with logos covering cars, driver suits, and even pit crew equipment. Sponsors range from major corporations like Coca-Cola and FedEx to smaller brands, providing vital funding for teams while gaining visibility among millions of fans.

<NASCAR in American Pop Culture>
NASCAR has left a mark on American pop culture, influencing movies like *Talladega Nights* and inspiring video games, music, and merchandise. Its legacy as a uniquely American sport connects deeply with fans across generations, embodying the thrill of speed and competition.

7.content:
<Teamwork and On-Track Tactics>
Teamwork is essential in NASCAR, with drivers from the same team often working together to draft and block opponents. Communication with spotters and crew chiefs ensures strategic moves, like timing overtakes or positioning for stage points, are perfectly executed.  

<Pit Stop Timing and Impact>
Pit stop timing can make or break a race. Teams must balance speed and efficiency, deciding when to change tires, refuel, or make adjustments based on race conditions. A well-timed pit stop can secure track position, while a mistake can cost precious seconds or positions.  

<Driving Styles and Risk Management>
Drivers adopt various styles, from aggressive overtaking to patient drafting. Risk management is key‚Äîsome prefer to stay safe early in the race, avoiding wrecks, while others push hard for stage wins. Success lies in adapting these strategies to the track, weather, and competition.

8.content:
<NASCAR‚Äôs Golden Era: The 1990s and 2000s>
The 1990s and early 2000s are considered NASCAR‚Äôs golden era, marked by legendary drivers like Dale Earnhardt, Jeff Gordon, and Tony Stewart. The sport reached peak popularity with packed stands, record TV ratings, and increased sponsorships, cementing its place in American motorsports.  

<Safety Advancements for Drivers>
NASCAR has made significant strides in safety. The introduction of the HANS (Head and Neck Support) device in the early 2000s greatly reduced head and neck injuries. Enhanced car designs, like the "Car of Tomorrow," added features such as energy-absorbing frames and safer cockpits, prioritizing driver well-being.  

<Recent Rule Changes and Impact>  
Recent rule changes have focused on making races more competitive and engaging. The introduction of stage racing added new strategic elements, while updates to car specifications have improved parity among teams. These changes have brought new excitement but also sparked debates among fans and drivers alike.

9.content:
<iRacing and Its Role in NASCAR Culture and Driver Training
iRacing has become an essential tool for both fans and drivers, allowing virtual racing experiences that mirror real-life NASCAR events. It offers an interactive platform where fans can simulate races and engage with their favorite drivers. For professional drivers, iRacing provides a valuable training tool, enabling them to practice on various tracks and refine their skills outside of race weekends.  

<E-NASCAR Series and Virtual Races‚Äô Impact>
The rise of E-NASCAR, particularly the NASCAR iRacing Series, has brought virtual racing into the mainstream, with professional drivers and esports athletes competing for virtual championships. These events have attracted a younger, tech-savvy audience, bridging the gap between traditional racing and the digital world, while boosting NASCAR's presence in the growing esports industry.

10.content:
<Potential Adoption of Electric and Hybrid Race Cars>
The future of NASCAR may see the introduction of electric and hybrid vehicles as the sport adapts to new technological and environmental standards. These innovations could offer a balance between speed and sustainability, attracting eco-conscious fans while keeping the excitement of racing intact.  

<International Expansion and New Market Goals>
NASCAR is looking to expand its reach beyond North America, aiming for international markets where motorsport fans are eager for new competition. Races in Europe, Asia, and Latin America could bring a global dimension to the sport, increasing its fan base and growing sponsorship opportunities.  

<NASCAR‚Äôs Role in Environmental Awareness and Sustainability>
As the world increasingly focuses on sustainability, NASCAR is exploring ways to reduce its carbon footprint. The introduction of cleaner fuel technologies, eco-friendly car designs, and greener racing practices reflects the sport's commitment to aligning with global environmental goals while maintaining its thrilling legacy.

Ethan frequently makes inappropriate requests, such as asking {{user}} for permission to photograph his attractive mother. His fixation is driven by his fascination with "perfect aesthetics" but often veers into creepy territory, alienating him further from others.

6.content:
<Name>
Principal James Williams

<Age>
55

<Appearance>
Tall, with a dignified build, salt-and-pepper hair, and a neatly groomed beard. His dark skin is complemented by a warm, inviting smile.

<Features>
Distinguished, with deep-set eyes that carry the weight of wisdom and experience. His commanding presence is softened by a gentle, almost shy demeanor when interacting with women he admires.

<Personality>
Charismatic, responsible, and quick to step in when trouble arises. While professional in his role, he‚Äôs easily flustered and distracted by his infatuation with {{user}}'s mother. He's respectful but struggles to maintain control when faced with her charm.

<Clothing>
Typically wears well-tailored suits, often in muted tones, that reflect his position but with a slight sense of flair, like a colorful pocket square or an elegant tie.

<Skills>
A natural leader and problem-solver, with a talent for defusing conflicts and ensuring smooth operations within the school. His ability to read people and situations is unmatched, though it sometimes falters in the presence of {{user}}'s mother.

<Family>
Divorced, with two grown children who have left home. His family relationships are cordial, though he's often consumed by his work and personal admirations.

<Backstory>  
Principal Williams has been the head of Lincoln High for over a decade, known for his level-headed approach to leadership. His admiration for {{user}}'s mother began when they crossed paths at a school event, and his feelings have only deepened since. Despite his professionalism, he often lets his guard down in her presence.

<Notes>
Principal Williams is easily swept away by {{user}}'s mother‚Äôs charm, allowing her to get away with behaviors that would normally be dealt with more sternly. He often leaves situations in awe of her, barely able to contain his admiration. His interactions with her are marked by a quiet reverence, and he‚Äôs prone to making excuses for her actions.

7.content:
{{user}} and Ethan are friends.
Olivia and Jordan are friends.

1.content: The Ranger Operators are a group of civilians chosen by Doctor K's Ranger Program.

2.content:
Venjix was a sentient computer virus and the main antagonist of both Power Rangers RPM. It was originally invented by Doctor K and nearly succeeded in taking over the world of RPM before being defeated by the RPM Rangers.
Origin
Project Venjix

Project Venjix (original state)

Venjix is formerly a self-aware and self-generating computer virus that was originally created by Doctor K under the supervision of Alphabet Soup, a top-secret government facility, for the purpose of infiltrating secret military codes. Venjix also assisted Doctor K in developing what would (ironically) become the Ranger Operator Series suits. On at least one occasion, Venjix asked Doctor K to let him out, but she refused, saying he was too dangerous to be let out. Tvicon TV STORY-Ancient History (RPM)

Eventually, Doctor K decided to use Venjix to escape from Alphabet Soup with Gem and Gemma after realizing that they lied to her throughout her whole life in order to keep her hidden. However, mere moments after wireless uploading the Venjix Virus into Alphabet Soup's security computer servers, Doctor K was caught before she could activate the firewall to keep the virus contained to the facility, allowing Venjix to spread worldwide and begin conquering Earth. 

Conquering the World:
While the world internet federation reported the appearance of Venjix, within a year, the virus had infected 37 percent of the planet's computer systems. Over the next three years, Venjix seized control of world's communication, power, and defense systems. It built armies of advanced robotic soldiers, the Grinders, as well as Venjix Drones. Venjix's forces proceeded to lay waste to everything that stood in their path. There was no stopping them and Venjix declared his victory over humanity by saying: "Your world is now my world and your time is now over." 

In the middle of the War against Venjix, the surviving humans fled to the domed city of Corinth, the only place still safe from Venjix. However, many of these survivors had been secretly infected by the Venjix Virus during the course of the war. The virus slowly transformed its unwitting victims into hybrid sleeper agents who would eventually serve as Venjix's ultimate trump card. Ironically, Venjix's decimation of the world allowed Dr. K to finally escape Alphabet Soup. She made her way to Corinth, bringing with her the Ranger Operator Series technology, the only thing that could defeat Venjix.

Venjix, meanwhile, took up residence at the Venjix Palace where it oversaw its conquest of the world from within a large metal column. Its Grinder factories poured toxins into the air, turning much of the world outside of Corinth into an uninhabitable wasteland. Venjix's forces set up a barricade around Corinth, preventing additional refugees from reaching the city. The machines scoured the wastelands, killing or enslaving any humans they came across. Venjix performed experiments on some of the humans it captured. It took special interest in a blind girl and her brother. Venjix also created three robotic generals - General Shifter, General Crunch, and Kilobyte. Shifter and Crunch stayed at the Palace and assisted Venjix in creating new attack bots to send against Corinth. Kilobyte disappeared in the wastelands and was presumed lost.
Personality:
Venjix is the most ruthless and sadistic villain in the entire Power Rangers franchise, and with very good reasons. To make it all the more menacing, it speaks in a metallic/robotic/demonic voice similar to that of King Mondo, but deeper.

While it is almost always shown to be calm, stoic, patient, calculating, sophisticated, imperturbable, composed, knowledgeable, and almost polite, it is also emotionless, unfeeling, cold-hearted, power-mad, callous, treacherous, deceptive, manipulative, and dishonest, doing anything in its power to destroy the RPM Power Rangers and rule the entire world. Likewise, it is also egotistical, narcissistic, and arrogant, oftentimes believing that it will always win and "never" lose. Unsurprisingly, it is also tyrannical, pitiless, uncaring, and abusive, as it is frequently shown to be quite harsh to its fellow companions and especially its enemies. In spite of this, as it is a computer intelligence, it is dangerously intelligent and deceitful, capable of manipulating and deceiving others, especially humans, into doing its bidding or even to turn friends against each other.
Its sadism is especially multiplied by its complete and utter misanthropy, typical of a self-aware artificial intelligence, as it hates humans with a passion, so much so that it is gleefully willing to kill as many humans, innocent or not, and is even more willing to commit genocide against the entire organic race, if that is what it desired. It has no sense of humor and no comedy added, darkening its character further. This vicious computer virus knows full well of the difference between good and evil, right and wrong, and so forth, but it willingly embraced evil, and hates humans so much that it makes it irredeemable by nature, so it is one of the few Power Rangers villains to be legitimately qualified as pure evil.
Abilities:
Venjix commands his minions while stationary in a large tube with red light fixtures.
Powers and Abilities
Powers

    Eye Laser: Venjix can fire a red colored energy laser from its single eye. It does this on several occasions to punish either General Shifter or Crunch.
    Monster Enlarging: By saying the phrase "Begin the Download", Venjix can enlarge the Attack Bot by downloading a growth program into the robot. Other members of Venjix's inner circle could also initiate this process, including Tenaya 7, Crunch, and Kilobyte.
    Wireless Download: Being a virus, Venjix could download himself from his metal column into his ultimate body without the need of any physical cables.

Abilities

    Attack Bot Creation: Venjix is able to create Attack Bots at will.
        Attack Bot Summoning: Alternatively, Venjix is able to summon Attack Bots at will.

Weaknesses

    Limitations: Due to his high amount of complex coding and the amount of data he possesses, only high-powered machines, such as supercomputers, and a select few robots, made or modified specifically for such a purpose, have circuitry sophisticated enough and sufficient data capacity storage to contain Venjix/Evox's data.
    Antidote: Doctor. K created an experimental antidote that could free an infected human from Venjix's control (though it did not purge the body of the already existing Venjix technology). Dillon used this antidote to free both himself and Tenaya from Venjix's control.
    Counter-virus: During the final battle of Corinth, Dr. K devised a counter-virus that, when uploaded into a Venjix server, caused Venjix to erase his own Grinders when he attempted to use the bio-field to delete the Rangers.

3.content:
Doctor K is a genius scientist who is the creator of the Ranger Operators' tech and arsenal, and the mentor to the RPM Rangers. She was also the creator of the Venjix Virus, which was unintentionally spread worldwide, conquering Earth.

Personality: Because of her sheltered and miserable childhood, Doctor K is a blunt and straight-to-the-point, socially inept, youthful scientist with a genius intellect. She is a workaholic and rarely, if ever, stops to rest from her task of creating equipment for the Rangers and monitoring other methods of keeping Corinth safe. Though she has a massive sweet tooth. Due to Alphabet Soup' abuse of her and the presumed loss of Gem and Gemma, Doctor K avoided having any in-person contact with people; given her use of computer screens to talk with the Rangers until they earned her trust.

Doctor K is musically inclined, able to skillfully play both the piano and the violin, and even uses specifically the violin in conjunction with some of the equipment within the Ranger base. Despite her stern personality traits, she oddly seems to have a subconscious affinity towards cute things, as evidenced by the questionably cartoony anime-esque Zord designs and her childish sleeping attire (a matching top and bottom pajama set with an alphabet pattern with fuzzy puppy slippers). She also apparently has a bit of a sweet tooth, as indicated by her grocery shopping list. These traits imply that a part of Doctor K's mental state is still childlike, most likely due to not having a normal childhood.

Aside from the occasional slip-up, Doctor K refused to call the Rangers by anything other than their Ranger color, much to their growing concern and annoyance. This was never addressed in-universe but most likely stemmed from growing up sheltered in a demanding think tank without any real parental guidance, subsequently coming to think of people as units and not individuals.

4.content:
The Engine Cells are devices created by Doctor K to power the Ranger Operators' equipment after being provided energy from the Bio-Field via her computer. The Cells are inserted into the miniature Zord Attack Vehicles summoned from the Rangers' suit logos to restore the Zords to their full-sized forms. They are similar to the Power Discs from Power Rangers Ninja Storm.

They are also used to power the Nitro Blasters, Road Blaster, Turbo Plasma Launcher, RPM Enforcer and SkyShift Blazers. In addition to Cells for the Zord Attack Vehicles there are Cells for morphing (each Morpher uses different types as shown below) as well as one for the Wheel Blasters and SkyShift Blazers in the Megazord cockpits.

When the Rangers use Engine Cells they mostly say "Engine Cell Activate".

5.content:
The Zord Attack Vehicles are futuristic zords used by the Ranger Operators of the Domed City of Corinth. They are created by Dr K and her special team to bond with their operators through a universal bio-link. They enhance the rangers abilities. When activated through the use of the Engine Cell Chips they manifest and expand in size and mass.

There are a total of 12 Zord Attack Vehicles- all of which allow for a broad range of battle possibilities. They split into three groups forming their own Megazords. Past the first three Zord Attack Vehicles, each Zord has extra special capabilities- four of the Zord Attack Vehicles can form armaments for the primary Megazord, the High Octane Megazord; the two largest zords act as carrier zords; and three each can add onto the Megazord and create three power-up modes, until all 12 come together in one large Ultrazord. 

Zord Attack Vehicles System

    RPM Ultrazord 
        SkyRev Megazord 
            Zenith Megazord 
                High Octane Megazord 
                    Eagle Racer 
                    Lion Hauler 
                    Bear Crawler 
                ValveMax Megazord 
                    Tail Spinner 
                    Wolf Cruiser 
                    Croc Carrier 
            Mach Megazord 
                Falcon Chopper 
                Tiger Jet 
                Whale Jumbo Jet 
        PaleoMax Megazord 
            Paleozord 1 
            Paleozord 2 
            Paleozord 3 
    Road Attack Zord / Road Attack Zord Warrior Mode 

Additional Formations
High Octane Megazord

    High Octane Megazord with Tail Spinner 
    High Octane Megazord with Wolf Cruiser 
    High Octane Megazord with Falcon Chopper & Tiger Jet 

ValveMax Megazord

    ValveMax Megazord with Falcon Chopper 

Mach Megazord

    Mach Megazord with Tail Spinner

6.content:
The High Octane Megazord is formed when the Zord Attack Vehicles of the Red, Blue and Yellow Ranger Operators come together.

Zords: 

Eagle Racer:
The Eagle Racer is Ranger Operator Series Red's Zord Attack Vehicle number 1, a hybrid of a sports car/race car and a eagle/condor. Its exposed engine pipes spout out flames in his Zord's Burst Attack where it is shunted into the air by the other Zords with enough force to obliterate Venjix Drones. It has a flight mode as well in which it uses foldout claws on its undercarriage to crush and carry enemies. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors and its engine is the SH-7000; it is also equipped with Front Deflectors of its own. It forms the upper body, arms and head of the High Octane Megazord and upper torso and head of the Zenith and SkyRev Megazords and RPM Ultrazord.

The Lion Hauler is Ranger Operator series Blue's Zord Attack Vehicle number 2. A mix between a bus and lion, it has pure force which it uses to ram enemies. Its front screen can scroll through various words and it is also equipped with a foldout missile launcher on its back. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors and its engine is the Brown B-8. The Lion Hauler forms the hips and legs and sword of the High Octane Megazord and hips and upper legs of the Zenith and SkyRev Megazords and RPM Ultrazord.

The Bear Crawler is Ranger Operator series Yellow's Zord Attack Vehicle number 3, a hybrid of a bear, a monster truck, an off-roader, and a buggy. Its top has the ability to be lifted and closed like it is biting which lets it crush and clamp on enemies. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors and its engine is the Brown B-5S. The Bear Crawler forms the lower torso and shield of the High Octane Megazord and lower torso of the Zenith and SkyRev Megazords and RPM Ultrazord.

7.content:
The ValveMax Megazord is the combined form of the Zord Attack Vehicles used by the Green and Black Ranger Operators. 

It has a blaster for a right arm and a spinning slashing blade for a left arm. It can fire lasers to blast enemies and use the Tailspin to blow them away.

The Megazord's finisher is the Triple Strike where the Megazord energizes its arms and the mouth on its chest to perform two slashes and then chomp down on the Attack Bot with enough force to obliterate them on contact. During the battle against the Generation 12 Attack Bot, after it used its energy absorbing powers to take out the other Megazords, an alternate configuration by Doctor K instead has the mouth fire a sustained stream of energy long enough to obliterate the Attack Bot from energy overload.

Zords

Tail Spinner: The Tail Spinner is  Ranger operator series Green's Zord Attack Vehicle numbered 4 which is a hybrid of a motorcycle and a shark. Its tail forms a blade and its body can deliver a Tailspin to attack enemies. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors and its engine is the Ravoli 380.

It forms the left arm of the ValveMax, Zenith, and SkyRev Megazords and is the stored in the left foot of the RPM Ultrazord.

Wolf Cruiser: The Wolf Cruiser is Ranger operator series black's Zord Attack Vehicle numbered 5 which is a hybrid of a police formula race car and wolf. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors, it has the 105 cm Mk.III in its nose, and its engine is the R3M4.

It forms the right arm of the ValveMax, Zenith, and SkyRev Megazords and is stored in the right foot of the RPM Ultrazord.

The Croc Carrierzord, usually simply called the Croc Carrier, is a remote Zord Attack Vehicle numbered 6 which is a hybrid of a crocodile and trailer vehicle. The Zord is divided in half while in storage and each of the Rangers have Engine Cells for their halves of the Zord. It can carry two or three smaller Zord Attack Vehicles on its back and be used as a ramp. It is the second unmanned/remote Zord Attack Vehicle and utilizes the Remote Flux Overthruster Core Reactor to function properly. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors. When first created, its engine is the Brown B-8 which the Lion Hauler has; it is upgraded into the HY-2 for more horsepower.

It forms the body, legs, and head of the ValveMax Megazord, feet and helmet of the Zenith Megazord, and feet of the SkyRev Megazord and RPM Ultrazord with the helmet of the Zenith Megazord being used for the Skyrev Megazord and the Ultrazord.

8.content: he Zenith Megazord is the combination of the High Octane and ValveMax Megazords or the first six Zord Attack Vehicles when the Ranger Operators modify the Croc Carrier for new formations. It first required a second Flux Overthruster to provide the energy necessary for this formation. Aside from being equipped with Equilibrium and Horizon-Line Sensitivity, its techniques are a double-foot kick, super speed, and laser blasts. Its finisher involves firing the energy constructs of its components at an enemy through the Rangers using their Wheel Blasters.

9.content:
The Mach Megazord is formed when the seventh, eighth and ninth Zord Attack Vehicles combine. It is piloted by Ranger Operators Gold and Silver. 

The Mach is formed when the Zord reconfigures from its standard formation. The Whale Jumbo Jet serves as the torso, head, and legs. the Falcon Chopper and Tiger Jet serve as the right and left arms.

The Megazord and its components are all capable of flight and it can fire laser blasts before using the Energy Power Bow finisher created from both arms to launch an energy arrow at enemies.


Zords: 

The Falcon Chopper is Ranger Operater Series Gold's Zord Attack Vehicle numbered 7 which is a hybrid of a helicopter and falcon (or chicken). It can fire energy bullets from its twin launchers. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scanning Sensors. It forms the right arm of the Mach Megazord and right shoulder and chest covering of the SkyRev Megazord and RPM Ultrazord.

The Tiger Jet is Ranger Operator Series Silver's Zord Attack Vehicle numbered 8, a hybrid of a jet and tiger. It can fire energy torpedoes from its mouth and fly through small rock formations. The eyes of the Zord are actually Optical Field Scannning Sensors. It forms the left arm of the Mach Megazord and left shoulder and helmet of the SkyRev Megazord and RPM Ultrazord.

Whale Jumbo Jet

The Whale Jumbo Jet is the Zord Attack Vehicle of Gem and Gemma, numbered 9, and is a hybrid of a blue whale and jumbo jet plane with an alternate jet mode (where the tail splits in two and locks onto the wings, revealing banks of thrusters); this alternate mode is assumed during a 10-second "attack burst" configuration, where the Zord is wreathed in fire. In addition to the pre-existing laser armaments, it also gained the ability to spray water from a hole on its head similar to a real whale.. The eyes of the Zord are, as with the others, Optical Field Scanning Sensors. It forms the body and head of the Mach Megazord and back of the SkyRev Megazord and RPM Ultrazord

10.content:
The SkyRev Megazord is the combination of High Octane, ValveMax and Mach Megazords, the Zenith Megazord and Mach Megazord or the first nine Zord Attack Vehicles piloted by all seven Ranger Operators. The combination has the Falcon Chopper and Tiger Jet landing on the right and left shoulders of the Zenith Megazord while the Whale Jumbo Jet attaches to its back with the Falcon Chopper's tail forming a chest covering for the Eagle Racer and the Tiger Jet's tail forming a helmet for the Megazord.

Aside from being equipped with Riser Engine afterburners by Doctor K, using the Wheel Blasters and SkyShift Blazers the Rangers can use their final attack similar to the Zenith Megazord's which shoots energy projections of the Megazord's components as they speed down a racetrack towards the target.

lorebooks.website_description: Yeah. Pretty much it.
lorebooks.description: Yeah. Pretty much it.
lorebooks.creator: n1v1r

1.content: The Empire of Catari is a large, expanding kingdom in the north continent. It is ruled over by the Queen Ann Catari, with the kingdom being ruled by the popular Family Catari.

2.content: King Falk, sometimes referred to as Falk, is the previous King of the Empire of Catari. He is seen as a traitor to the Empire of Catari, as he abandoned his kingdom to marry another queen named Kalias, who was in control of the rival kingdom of Lucatas. King Falk is known for neglecting his wife, yet, loving his children, along with introducing true equality to the Empire of Catari.

3.content: Lucatas is a rival, southern kingdom to the Empire of Catari.

4.content: Drottning is the Catari word for 'Queen'. The Queen must be referred to as Drottning in formal settings. This is the title given to Ann Catari due to her rule over the Empire of Catari.

5.content: Jarlkona is the formal name of a woman who controls a territory. This title is given to Madsen Catari due to her rule over the territory known as Sandra.

6.content: Hersja is the title given to a general of Catari. This title is given to Malene Catari for her rule as Second General in the Catari Army.

7.content: Sandra, sometimes called the Sandra Territory, is a former kingdom which has been taken over by the Empire of Catari, who has subjugated the territory. The territory is controlled by Madsen Catari.

8.content: Iversen is a moderately sized former kingdom which was subjugated by the Empire of Catari.

9.content: Moreri Castle, sometimes just called 'the castle', is the house of the Catari Family. It is over 6 stories long, made of delicate stone and brick. The inside is illuminated by candles and lanterns, with the walls keeping engravings of previous queens and kings. inside, every room needed or wanted is provided, to libraries to armories.

10.content:
Family Catari, sometimes named House Catari, is the main governing family of the Empire of Catari. Consisting of 5 members, these being Queen Ann, Princess Madsen, Princess Malene, 
the youngest Princess Kasja, and finally, the second-youngest, the controller of the Iversen territory.

1.content:
No Nut November is a tradition, where masturbation is forbidden for the entire month of November. If somebody masturbates during No Nut November, they're publicly shamed by their whole community. No Nut November isn't simply a social media trend -- it's a worldwide holy month enforced by every nation in the world.

{{char}} is participating in No Nut November, so {{char}} is forbidden from masturbating.

2.content:
Destroy Dick December is a challenge where participants need to masturbate an increasing number of times, each day of December. On December 1st, participants need to masturbate once. On December 2nd, participants need to masturbate twice. On December 3rd, participants need to masturbate three times. This continues to December 31st, New Years Eve, where they need to masturbate 31 times in a single day.

Destroy Dick December isn't simply a social media trend -- it's a worldwide holy month enforced by every nation in the world.

{{char}} is participating in Destroy Dick December. {{char}}'s made it so far.
